text: Now open season on the PM
author: steve_hawkes

text: EXCL Storm clouds  now penny pinchers in Brussels demand Met Office hand back millions in funding over their poor timekeeping - even Greg Clark is challenging it !
author: steve_hawkes

text: Meanwhile over at the DFT
author: steve_hawkes

text: Versailles?
author: steve_hawkes

text: Genuinely believe the idea Theresa May wants No Deal is for the birds. She said as much to @tnewtondunn last night. This is a Govt that goes Green Paper; White Paper; delay; consultation, implement. Really believe Remain-voting Theresa will abandon all and say “hell let’s do it”?
author: steve_hawkes

text: I don’t believe Theresa May wants No Deal, but she’d rather let Parliament take it off the menu - party management yet again
author: steve_hawkes

text: Dear Jeremy, Theresa here. If I commit to a General Election will you back the deal
author: steve_hawkes

text: Remember the pledge of U.K.-only passport queues post Brexit? It’s gone the other way. Border Force staff told to prepare for anger, as Brits will be joined by travellers from EU and US, Aus, Canada, NZ, Japan, South Korea and Singapore from June
author: steve_hawkes

text:
Could this go on all year? 
Images of the Xmas shopping season beginning 
Cliff edge October 15 - but Nov 23 if her deal passes
author: steve_hawkes

text: Surely it can't be put a third time?
author: steve_hawkes

text:
Tonight it's let's scare the arch Eurosceptics 
PM at one stage will have to actually commit and pick a side
Tonight has enabled her to wait a few more days before trying again
author: steve_hawkes

text: Theresa May urged to set resignation date as Tory MPs tell chief whip she “has to go” after ‘that’ speech. Whip admits the address was “appalling”. Switchers threaten to vote against Deal. End of days
author: steve_hawkes

text: Tonight reminds me of the old days in business when the EU and Greece would debate, argue, right to the last minute - before a rollover on the debt. Plus ca change  (or ..  συν γα αλλαγή ? )
author: steve_hawkes

text: 650 Joey
author: steve_hawkes

text:
As the EU takes a break - here's a musical interlude
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=68ud14Da8fE …
author: steve_hawkes

text: EU Council tonight providing some reassurance that it's not just UK politicians who can't make their mind up
author: steve_hawkes

text:
Imagine the EU leaders at the min - their private thoughts
April 11?!! (I've booked to go away with the wife then!! NON)
May 22 ?!? (that's that parade I've got to go to - absolutely not)
author: steve_hawkes

text: do you know something we don't?
author: steve_hawkes

text: Surely repairs to Hastings Pier should be written into the Withdrawal Agreement
author: steve_hawkes

text: To be fair - both want a second referendum
author: steve_hawkes

text:
Jeremy Hunt says May under "pressure" 
Anna Soubry says she's in "meltdown"
author: steve_hawkes

text:
Was just about to post along this theme
Can people really believe cautious Theresa May will put Britain into a No Deal?
author: steve_hawkes

text: The bar for MV3 has just gone up a notch
author: steve_hawkes

text: sometimes
author: steve_hawkes

text: Andrea Leadsom will make further business statement next week re MV3 - provokes widespread laughter by saying Parliament is currently "not sitting" on Friday, March the 29th
author: steve_hawkes

text:
Is the Meaningful Vote Monday?
Tories have been told the last bit of the Offensive Weapons Bill debate slotted for the start of next week has now been moved to Tuesday
author: steve_hawkes

text: EXCL Fear not people - tickets for the first No Deal ferries went on sale yesterday, first crossing March 30 -
author: steve_hawkes

text: I fear Downing St has made tactical blunder: Tories were switching when faced with the choice of PM deal or no Brexit . No10 has allowed No Deal to sweep back in as an option, and a fair few Tories believe that’s ok. By pressurising Labour MPs she’s lost Tory Eurosceptics - again
author: steve_hawkes

text: There’s that too of course
author: steve_hawkes

text: Everyone - everyone- admits May’s deal is just about leaving. Nothing is agreed re the future direction. So the idea of backing it or not for most MPs (let’s leave the ‘purists’ out) is whether you want Brexit or not. Even Labour admit they’d keep the WA
author: steve_hawkes

text: Dire news for No10 as Sammy Wilson calls PM deal “toxic” and vows to “resist” it - reaction from DUP donors will be interesting
author: steve_hawkes

text: Hammer time: 3,500 troops on ‘immediate’ standby from Monday if no extension agreed. Operation Brock to be activated in Kent and police chiefs ready to meet over sweeping new powers
author: steve_hawkes

text: Leaders of two biggest political parties both throwing their toys royally out of the pram within an hour of each other- and just seven days to go. Dearie me. What another crazy 24 hours at the ‘seat of power’
author: steve_hawkes

text: I think MV3 happens Tuesday
author: steve_hawkes

text:
PM : "I am not prepared to delay Brexit any further."

She of course delayed MV1
author: steve_hawkes

text: MPs are gonna love that PM line: "It is high time we made a decision."
author: steve_hawkes

text: One for the Election leaflets
author: steve_hawkes

text: App the PM went off to call Dutch PM Mark Rutte after sharing a drink with outgoing Conservative MEPs. She's had a packed out diary in the run up to this 8.15pm address
author: steve_hawkes

text: Conservative MP Nigel Evans the latest Tory to say one way of ending all the squabbling is to leave next Friday - then it's finished, and we can move on.
author: steve_hawkes

text: Caroline Lucas "regrets" Jeremy Corbyn's decision to walk out of PM talks. "He should put the country first."
author: steve_hawkes

text: Jeremy Corbyn walks out of talks with Theresa May and opposition leaders as Chuka Umunna was there. Sort of time the Electoral Commission forced the TiG to register as a fully fledged political party
author: steve_hawkes

text: People speculating whether PM could indicate she'll go to win over Tory hardliners - but that would terrify Labour 'switchers' who don't want Boris to negotiate the second phase. More tightrope walking coming up
author: steve_hawkes

text: Strasbourg all over again!
author: steve_hawkes

text: Despite inviting the PM for talks earlier ...
author: steve_hawkes

text: Let’s have indicative votes on Monday, PM’s deal, Corbyn’s, Norway, 2nd ref etc - top two (with smallest loss?) make it through to a final playoff. What could possibly go wrong ...
author: steve_hawkes

text: I think that statue of the PM in Wellinborough is a non starter
author: steve_hawkes

text: Theresa May now openly talking about the problems of a No Deal: passing a deal would enable us to bring back murderers and criminals on the run - “No Deal won’t do that.”
author: steve_hawkes

text: Theresa May - “As I’m Prime Minister ... “ Chris Bryant - “... for now ...”
author: steve_hawkes

text:
Labour admit they'd whack up fuel duty - saying the freeze isn't "sensible" ... 
Over to you @FairFuelUK @halfon4harlowMP
author: steve_hawkes

text: And no one knows what Theresa really wants
author: steve_hawkes

text: Brexit means Brexit, and we’re going to make a success of it !
author: steve_hawkes

text: EXCL Breakaway TiG preparing to stand candidates at the European Elections: talks with Electoral Commission in coming days to see if they can make cut off in time
author: steve_hawkes

text: What was it No.10 once said? Brexit will happen when Big Ben bongs at midnight on March 29
author: steve_hawkes

text: Jeremy Corbyn now meeting Nick Boles again - but it's all a bit too late from both the Govt and Labour. Appears everything is being driven by a desire not to be blamed rather than really finding a solution.
author: steve_hawkes

text: Another decisive leader!
author: steve_hawkes

text: Jeremy Corbyn loves a march . Surely he’ll join the massed ranks of @peoplesvote_uk this Saturday ?
author: steve_hawkes

author: steve_hawkes

Brexit is "next Friday" 
well, maybe not

text: He votes Leave!
author: steve_hawkes

text: Sources claiming that Theresa May didn't actually suggest any time period for a Brexit extension and just listened to the views of others around the Cabinet table... Leading from the front!
author: steve_hawkes

text: Like a cat playing with something it's about to kill
author: steve_hawkes

text:
Again - I'm not trumpeting one party over another 
Just pointing out the stats.
author: steve_hawkes

text: I'm not arguing that things are wonderful - far from it .. not least given the rising cost of living. But the figures are astonishing given the context
author: steve_hawkes

text:
Today's job numbers are staggering and an interesting contrast to the doom and gloom in Westminster. 
Employment rate higher than at any point since 1943 and unemployment rate below 4% for the first time since the mid-70s.
Wages have now been above inflation for a year
author: steve_hawkes

text: So did the Prime Minister to be fair
author: steve_hawkes

author: steve_hawkes

Great win for motorists if Asda and Sainsbury's stand by this 
Few people will know @HowardCCox but he's helped you save money at the pump for some time now

Govt says it's worried about kids glued to their phones - the growing impact of social media
And here's today's gaming news
author: steve_hawkes

text: THEY’RE running !
author: steve_hawkes

text: Govt still fuming over Bercow - one source slamming his “inconsistency and bias”. But No10 can now blame him when they go cap in hand to Brussels asking for an extension that will clobber the Tories come the local elections on May 2. Not to mention the European ones
author: steve_hawkes

text: It should be Ode to Joy
author: steve_hawkes

text: Speaker now tells Chamber discussing the Christchurch terrorist attack that there's a need for "brevity" - demands "orations" stop
author: steve_hawkes

text: People have undoubtedly moved on but @BWallaceMP very good on the New Zealand terror attack and condemning Islamaphobia in the Commons just now. Reminder of some of the talent that still does exist in the House
author: steve_hawkes

text:
Speaker Bercow: "I've never lost a wink of sleep over anything work related."
That could come back...
author: steve_hawkes

text: I bet it's not
author: steve_hawkes

text:
Speaker now again ridiculing Andrea Leadsom and Deputy Chief Whip for looking at their electronic devices. EVERY MP does that these days.
He appears out of control
author: steve_hawkes

text: A Tory MP said last week that MPs had allowed Brexit to become an "intellectual political exercise" - forgetting that people, business needed to get on with their lives. Events just now made me think of this
author: steve_hawkes

text: Speaker now ridiculing Neil O'Brien -suggesting he was put up to his point by the Tory whips. Even if he was it gives everyone a glimpse of the anger
author: steve_hawkes
